main_definition: Widescreen refers to a display format with an aspect ratio greater than the traditional 4:3, often associated with modern televisions, computers, and movies.

meanings_and_examples.example: A widescreen TV has a standard 16:9 aspect ratio.
When purchasing a computer monitor, you might choose a widescreen option for more horizontal viewing space.
Many modern films are released in the widescreen format to take advantage of its broader visual field.
A landscape shot often uses a widescreen format to encompass more of the scene's width.
